title.narrative: Leading from the South- Linking and Learning

description.narrative: Grassroots, intermediate and large southern women´s rights organisations (SWROs).
Support to linking and learning activities that leads to capacity development, specially on the field of L&A.
To strengthen the capacity of SWROs to advance women’s rights and gender equality. To increase women leadership.

recipient-region.narrative: LFS covers 21 OECD countries in Latinamerica.

description.narrative: Four main activities were conducted in terms of Linking and Learning during 2020: 1) Special L&L grants to 16 organisations were awarded within the framework of the special call "Activism in pademic". This activity was designed in 2020 in order to respond to the context of the Covid 19 crisis. The resources initially planned for L&L activities were reallocated to these special grants. 2) Two capacity development workshops on resource mobilisation we conducted at the end of october, 3) The IV Regional Meeting of LFS Coparts in LAC was celebrated on Nov 5-6, on virtual basis, with more that 40 organisations participating (and more than 100 participants), 4) Participation on the IV virtual L&L meeting, for the LFS Consortium (Nov, 23, 24, 25 and 26). Only the first activity mentioned (16 special grants awarded) was fiananced with L&L budget (Eur 110.000). Activities # 2, 3 and 4 were supported making use of FMS overhead for LFS.

Includes: Platform for virtual meetings (Design and implementation of a Tool Box to promote the exchange of materials among grantees), celebration of the III Regional Grantees Meetings for LFS coparts in LAC (October, 2019; Montevideo, Uruguay); participation in the Annual Face to Face meetings among Southern Regional Women's Funds (November, 2019; Ghana).
